title: Toxic Mist
content:
Toxic Mist is a sub weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. It is a thrown bottle that, on impact, releases a toxic cloud that slows and drains the ink of any enemies within it.

When thrown, Toxic Mist surrounds a circular area in fog. Opponents caught in the fog move more slowly and gradually lose ink.

Players that stay in the fog for a long time are more severely affected.[1] It takes about 8.33 seconds for Toxic Mist to deplete a full ink tank, even with the high-capacity ink tank that comes with the Splattershot Jr. The fog remains on the stage for about 5.13 seconds before dissipating. Prior to Version 5.2.0, players in a Baller were immune to Toxic Mist.[2] Dualies that perform a dodge roll while they are in Toxic Mist use up 3.5 times the ink.[3]

Sub Power Up increases throwing range and air travel velocity for Toxic Mist.

In the Octo Canyon levels Octoling Assault and Octoling Workout, Toxic Mist appears as a stationary obstacle. This version of Toxic Mist appears as a bottle similar to the version thrown as a sub weapon, which activates when Agent 4 approaches it, creating a sphere of mist surrounding it. Unlike the sub-weapon version of Toxic Mist, this version does not dissipate over time, only disappearing when the bottle in the center of the mist is destroyed by ink.

- ▲ Reduced ink consumption from 70% to 60% of ink-tank capacity.

- ▲ Reduced delay until start of ink recovery after using Toxic Mist by 25/60 of a second.

- ▼ Reduced the effect time from 7 seconds to 5 seconds.

- ▼ Reduced the Ink Saver (Sub) effect by roughly 14%.

- ▲ The sound effect for Toxic Mist will now be played again when an opponent enters the affected area.

- — Made it easier to hear the sound effects when it detonates.

- ▲ Adjusted the sound effect caused when an opponent enters the area of effect of Toxic Mist, making it easier to distinguish if they are nearby or far away.

- ▲ Added effect that forces the amount of ink consumed for an opponent using a dualie-type weapon and performing a dodge roll while inside Toxic Mist to be multiplied by 3.5.

- ▲ This will now effect[sic] opponent's Ballers.

The movement of any opponent who enters the mist will be slowed and their ink tank will slowly drain.

The longer the time spent in the mist, the stronger the effect.

Toxic Mist returns in Splatoon 3, functioning the same as it did previously.

Toxic Mist appears in Side Order as the base sub weapon of Shiver's Palette. They also appear as a purchasable sub weapon on Vending-Machine Corner Floors, costing 500 Membux by default.

- — Fixed an issue where a Point Sensor or Toxic Mist would disappear without activating when hitting certain terrain or an Ultra Stamp.

- ▲ Reduced the amount of ink consumed from 60% of a standard ink tank to 55%.

- ▼ Increased the amount of time it takes for ink to begin recovering after throwing by about 1/12th of a second: 75 frames → 80 frames.

For competitive tips about Toxic Mist

- According to the sub and special guide in Splatoon 2, the mist is "The bodily fluids of a certain creature". This creature is unknown but it might be poisonous.

- According to the poem of the Toxic Mist mem cake, the mist has a sickly sweet aroma.

- The Toxic Mist is created by Nouveau.
